intro: Gonolobus luteus, commonly known as the yellow globeflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in globular inflorescences. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Gonolobus luteus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
